page.title: 14OLD HOUSES IN WOOBURN GREEN
page.content: WOOBURN MANOR HOUSE.Mentioned in first Domesday Bk.Held by D'Eyncourt was Palace of Bishops of Lincoln.Tithe Barn is 15 century.Manor now owned by a local builder.HEDSOR PRIORY on 80 acres dates from 12 century.Rights of way to Hedsor Church and other private houses. Listed Tudor arch and flint and stone wall in garden.Now owned by former Lord Mayor of London,Sir Hugh Wontner.HEDSOR WHARF-in 28 acres has remains of Roman road.King Alfred camped here.Wharf used to load cereals,hops and wood for London.Stone for Houses of Parliament ferried from here.Lock built in 1832. Wharf now a backwater.Present owner "Tiny"Rowland,international business tycoon.BOSCABEL HOUSE-building on site for 700yrs.Wattle and Daub walls.Was inn named Royal Oak,when Charles II fled to France.Tithe Barn ajoining was converted to residence in 1932.
